troubleshooting.title: Connected device not displayed in 'Device Name' list

condition.p: When you cannot see the connected device displayed in the list, it can be because one of the following causes:

cause.p: If you do mobile testing with iOS devices, make sure you enable UI Automation on the device. Do as follows:

step.cmd: Go to Settings > Developer and turn on UIAutomation.
Check if your device is recognized using the following commands on Terminal:

li.p: If your iOS version is iOS 11, make sure the version of Katalon Studio is 5.3.0+.

cause.p: If you do mobile testing with Android devices, make sure to turn on the phone developer mode. Do as follows:

step.cmd: Connect your phone to the computer via a USB cable.
Go to Settings > Developer options, enable:

ul.li: USB debugging – Debug mode when USB is connected.
Install via USB – Allow installing apps via USB.
USB debugging (Security Setting) – Allow granting permissions and simulating input via USB debugging.

step.cmd: Make sure a trusted connection is established by tapping on Trust this computer whenever this dialog is displayed on your device.
Check if the device is listed using adb command:

substep.cmd: On Windows command line/ MacOS terminal: Navigate to platform-tools folder in <Android SDK folder>\platform-tools.
Type in "adb devices" and observe devices listed there. Make sure that your corrected device is listed there with online status.
